alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 1:01PM EST until January 09 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in northeast West Virginia, Northwest Pocahontas, Southeast Pocahontas, Southeast Randolph and Southeast Webster. In southeast West Virginia, Southeast Fayette and Southeast Nicholas. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain can be expected on Tuesday. This rain will combine with melting snow to provide a threat for flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
